name.en: Special topics on structural geology and geological modeling
name.ch: 構造地質學及地質模型建置特論

department.ch: 應用地質研究所碩士班

goal.ch:
Audience: Graduate students with a (strong) background in structural geology, motivated to strengthen their skills for research/professional goals  

Objectives:
- Strengthen background and general skills in structural geology
- Learn practical applications of structural geology in various fields of interest via the utilization of a designated software
goal.en:
Audience: Graduate students with a (strong) background in structural geology, motivated to strengthen their skills for research/professional goals  

Objectives:
- Strengthen background and general skills in structural geology
- Learn practical applications of structural geology in various fields of interest via the utilization of a designated software

outline.ch:
This course is designed for graduate students with a strong background in structural geology and willing to strengthen their skills and learn how to use a structural geology software for research or professional applications.
At the beginning of the semester, students will design their own project based on their research goals or the skill they wish to gain, and choose the tools they want to use accordingly. Learning will be self-driven, each student working on his/her own project, guided by the instructor. Regular progress presentations will allow everyone to share their progress and the challenges met, so that everyone can learn from others’ projects.
- List of potential applications: 1. Draw and restore geological cross-sections. 2. Build a 2D/3D geological model, 3. Invert stress field based on strain observations, 4. Analyze a seismic line. 5. … and any other applications that you may be interested in
- List of possible software to utilise: MOVE Suite, Rockworks, StructureSolver, … or a software of your suggestion.
outline.en:
This course is designed for graduate students with a strong background in structural geology and willing to strengthen their skills and learn how to use a structural geology software for research or professional applications.
At the beginning of the semester, students will design their own project based on their research goals or the skill they wish to gain, and choose the tools they want to use accordingly. Learning will be self-driven, each student working on his/her own project, guided by the instructor. Regular progress presentations will allow everyone to share their progress and the challenges met, so that everyone can learn from others’ projects.
- List of potential applications: 1. Draw and restore geological cross-sections. 2. Build a 2D/3D geological model, 3. Invert stress field based on strain observations, 4. Analyze a seismic line. 5. … and any other applications that you may be interested in
- List of possible software to utilise: MOVE Suite, Rockworks, StructureSolver, … or a software of your suggestion.

textbook.ch: Classical textbooks on structural geology, rock mechanics, geological modeling may be used as support if needed.
textbook.en: Classical textbooks on structural geology, rock mechanics, geological modeling may be used as support if needed.

gradMethod.ch: Grading will be based on the level of difficulty and ambition of the project, the performance during the project development, the presentations quality and the participation during presentations
gradMethod.en: Grading will be based on the level of difficulty and ambition of the project, the performance during the project development, the presentations quality and the participation during presentations

flexDiscription.ch: Course duration will be adjusted to the number of students (oral presentations) and on the progress of students on their projects
flexDiscription.en: Course duration will be adjusted to the number of students (oral presentations) and on the progress of students on their projects
